result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcel A. Reid Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marcel A. Reid Sr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marcel A. Reid Sr was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcel A. Reid Sr

records.addlTxt: Counts 1, 2 & 4 dismissed on State's motion
Conditions of Extended Supervision

11:27 AM Attorney Drew Lehman appeared for the Prosecution. Defendant Marcel A. Reid appeared with Attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Defendant in custody. Clerk: S.Shaw.
MINUTES: Hearing held on behalf of Branch 3. Deft has no objection to Branch 6 hearing the case. The parties are prepared to proceed with sentencing on today's date.
Court imposes a total sentence of 3 years WSP: 12 Months initial confinement w/credit for 165 days served, 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP, deft is eligible for SAP; deft previously submitted DNA sample and deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Lehman appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody along w/Atty Michael Barth.  VRC.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty to count 3; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 7/8/22 @ 11:15am.
Jury selection on June 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling Order
Jury selection on June 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on May 5, 2022 at 10:45 am.
